title: Ticket #1925: interaction of addr space randomization w/checkpointing needs update
description:
Summarization of a condor-users post by Roberto Nunnari:

Using standalone checkpointing on an x86_64 RedHat release, it doesn't work.

Command to invoke executable which is to be interrupted with SIGTSTP: 

$ ./blah3 -_condor_D_ALL

The answer from Daniel Forrest points out that "this should really be spelled out BOLDLY in the Condor manual." The problem is with address space randomization, and while the manual does identify the problem in section 6.1.2, it needs updating, as the invocation it gives is wrong, and this problem is general to all Linux platforms for which we support condor_compile and have address space randomization. So the documentation is not really in the right place.
remarks:
